en: The Moving Image: Connecting European Films to a Global Audience
At Cannes 2015, the European Film Forum and the European Commission invite professionals in the sector to a conference on the challenges of the film industry in the digital era.
The Moving Image: Connecting European Films to a Global Audience
47-Event (announcement, program or report of an event such as a seminar, conference, exhibition, etc.)
At Cannes 2015, the European Film Forum and the European Commission invite professionals in the sector to a conference on the challenges of the film industry in the digital era.

Date: 14:30 - 17:30 (CET), Monday 18 May

Venue: Salon des Ambassadeurs - Cannes, France

If you happen to be in Cannes attending the film festival then do not miss the conference organised by the European Commission in the frame of the European Film Forum.

Commissioner Günther Oettinger will welcome the panels and open the discussion on how to reach a wider audience in Europe and worldwide.

Session 1 - European creations without borders will analyse the impact of digital technologies on how films are promoted and distributed to the public, and look at how to ensure European films reach as wide an audience as possible within the European Union (EU).

Session 2 - Reaching out to new audiences worldwide will focus on export of European films outside the EU. It will analyse the situation in the USA, still the most important market for European films, and in China, a relatively new and not yet fully explored market. Fresh figures will be presented by the European Audiovisual Observatory.

  • What do these figures tell us about what the priorities should now be to reach new audiences worldwide?
  • And what can the European film industry learn from others about how best to address this issue?

Save the date and stay tuned, a more detailed programme will be released soon.

Please note that accreditation to the Film festival is required for access to the event.
